dict.string: The easiest health-boosting points ever—drink a glass of this magical, thirst-quenching, calorie-free drink we call water.
Got a Block? Walk around it!
At work, at home, before you grocery shop—wherever you stand, you're usually near a block. Walk around it for a Power-up! It only takes a few minutes.
Give yourself a hug or a pat on the arm or back while telling your body what a great job it's doing—just the way it is.
Let Your Hunger Be Your Guide
Eating when you are genuinely hungry or stopping eating when you’re no longer hungry.
Battle this Bad Guy by standing up and taking a single step away from the chair or couch!
Unless you’re a standup comic or training to be a kick boxer, there’s really no reason to beat yourself up.
Give yourself a mood boost by doing a quick Google image search for "baby [your favorite animal]."
What’s one thing that you know helps you feel better?
What reliably gives you a lift?
What new habit would you like to create?
What’s a tiny step that you know would help you reach your goals if you stuck with it?
Looking at nature builds the soul. Spend some time looking at the beauty of nature that's all around you.
Stop, and take 5 or 10 breaths. Be mindful of each, and allow the focus on the breath to calm the mind.
Write a well thought out, positive comment on a forum or message board somewhere.
Improve your diet by grabbing some fruit. Better still, replace something less healthy you were going to eat with fruit. It's just as tasty, and much better for you!
Get all touchy-feely and hug a friend.
...Again. Go on, have a dance to the Time Warp: - or to any other lively song for that matter.
Text something silly or sweet to a loved one.
Treat yourself to a massage. This can be a professional massage, one from a friend or loved one, or just spending some time rubbing your own feet.
Walk just a little further than usual. This can be as small as getting off the bus one stop earlier or later than usual. Even a few extra steps count.
Watch a documentary or movie. And really watch it, use some mindfulness to be sure you aren't actually elsewhere.
Focus on sitting up straight for five minutes or one song or while interacting with someone.

Do something practical to help improve the space around you. For example, clean the floor, or wash the dishes, or change the bed... it doesn't need to be a big thing to help make the apartment a better place to be.
Boost your enjoyment of your environment by using scents. Light a scented candle, use scented cream, smell essential oils, or use joss sticks to enhance the room.
Walk up at least one flight of stairs rather than using the elevator or escalator.
Sit somewhere sunny for at least 10 minutes. Don't forget the sunscreen if it's longer!
Continuing the goal of improving your environment by cleaning the apartment - next on the list is to clean the fridge!
Write to someone you haven't talked to in quite a while.
Meditate for at least 10 minutes, using any form of meditation that suits you. For example you could sit and focus on your breath, counting to 10, then repeating.
Find a new recipe and cook it.

Or on the beach, or down the road, or anywhere really. The important part is that it's time to get some real exercise. So let's go for a walk! Ideally, find somewhere pleasant and uplifting to walk, and keep going for at least an hour. But even half an hour will do, just get moving!
